STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ROBERT GORDON
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
September 23, 2020
Timothy Click
Allegan County DHHS
3255 122nd Street
Allegan, MI 49010
RE: License #: CP030200937
Allegan County DHHS
3255 122nd Street
Allegan, MI 49010
Dear Mr. Click:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
September 8-15, 2020. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required.
It should be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of
the MISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of
this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular certificate of approval
license will be issued. If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan,
disciplinary action will result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616)552-3662.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Holly Austin, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
Suite 200
121 Franklin Street SE
Grand Rapids, MI 49507
(269) 330-7082
enclosure
2

DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules
except for the following:
R 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy.
(1) An agency's medical and dental care policy shall, at a
minimum, include all of the following:
(f) The provision of a dental examination and any
treatment required for each child who is 4 years of age and
older, including both of the following:
(i) A dental examination within 12 months before
placement or a new dental examination shall be completed
not more than 90 calendar days after placement.
One of Six open foster care case files reviewed did not have documentation that a
dental examination was completed within the required timeframe
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance will all additional MISEP requirements except for the following:
ISEP 6.12.a & b - Maximum Children in a Foster Home
Page 20
(a) No child shall be placed in a foster home if that
placement will result in: (1) more than three foster children
in that foster home; (2) a total of six children, including the
foster family’s birth and adopted children; or (3) more than
three children under the age of three residing in that foster
home.
(b) Exceptions to these limitations may be made by the
Director of the DCWL, on an individual basis documented
in the case file, when in the best interest of the child(ren)
being placed.
4

One of two foster home files reviewed that required a Placement Exception Request
(PER) did not have a currently approved PER in the case file.
This is a repeat violation cited in the 2018 renewal inspection report dated
10/2/2018. A CAP for this citation was approved on 11/1/2018. This is a repeat
violation cited in the 2019 interim inspection report dated 10/1/2019 at which
time 2 of 2 files were found to be in violation. A CAP for this citation was
approved on 11/19/2019.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Policy violation. Please note that there
are additional DHHS Policy requirements that may not be included in section 1. The
facility is incompliance will all additional DHHS Policy requirements except for the
following:
FOM 801 Page Medical Passports
11-13
Updated Medical Passport
All medical information within the medical passport must
be current and updated at least quarterly to reflect the
child's current and complete health information.
Receipt of the medical passport by the required parties is
documented in MiSACWIS by uploading the signed and
dated signature page into the Health Profile section.
MiSACWIS Medical Passport Receipt Requirement
Additional documentation of medical passport receipt is
required for the following:
• For every placement/replacement the foster care provider
must be provided with the child's current medical passport
at or prior to placing the child.
One of six open foster care case files reviewed did not contain updated medical
passports for one quarter or for on replacement.
This is a repeat violation cited in the 2018 renewal inspection report dated
10/2/2018. A CAP for this citation was approved on 11/1/2018. This is a repeat
violation cited in the 2019 interim inspection report dated 10/1/2019 at which
time 2 of 2 files were found to be in violation. A CAP for this citation was
approved on 11/19/2019.
FOM 722-06B Family Team Meeting
page 1-7
Updated Case Plan (USP) - within 30 calendar days before
the case plan due date.
5

One of six open cases reviewed did not have documented service plan FTMs for two
reporting periods.
This is a repeat violation cited in the 2018 renewal inspection report dated
10/2/2018. A CAP for this citation was approved on 11/1/2018. This is a repeat
violation cited in the 2019 interim inspection report dated 10/1/2019 at which
time 2 of 2 files were found to be in violation. A CAP for this citation was
approved on 11/19/2019.
FOM 722-09 Supervisory Approval - USP
Page 27
Prior to finalizing, the USP along with the required
assessments (FANS, CANS, etc.) must be reviewed and
approved by the foster care supervisor only after a face-to-
face meeting with the foster care worker.
Case service plan approval process requires the foster care
supervisor to:
• Review and approve the USP within 14 calendar days of
the report date.
One of six open foster care case files reviewed contained a report that was
approved outside of the 14-day requirement.
This is a repeat violation cited in the 2018 renewal inspection report dated
10/2/2018. A CAP for this citation was approved on 11/1/2018. This is a repeat
violation cited in the 2019 interim inspection report dated 10/1/2019 at which
time 2 of 2 files were found to be in violation. A CAP for this citation was
approved on 11/19/2019.
FOM 722-09C FOSTER CARE ACTION SUMMARY REQUIREMENTS
Page 1-2
The FC/JJ action summary meets licensing requirements
for replacement documentation (See FOM 722-03) and in
most cases, agency transfer and case closing summary
(see below).The FC/JJ action summary must also be used
for foster care transfer to adoption.
Which Cases/When:
All foster care cases where there is:
6. Case closing
One of four closed foster care case files reviewed did not contain a closing Action
Summary.
This is a repeat violation cited in the 2018 renewal inspection report dated
10/2/2018. A CAP for this citation was approved on 11/1/2018. This is a repeat
6

violation cited in the 2019 interim inspection report dated 10/1/2019 at which
time 2 of 2 files were found to be in violation. A CAP for this citation was
approved on 11/19/2019.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
Some documents were uploaded during the course of the inspection when it was
discovered they were not present. One worker reported that she checks to make
sure her documents are uploaded every 3 months. It was recommended that this be
done on a more frequent basis to avoid errors.
V. CONSULTATION
No consultation was requested or needed during the inspection.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There was one incident of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period. The investigation of the family substantiated for corporal punishment was
reviewed and was found to be thorough and complete.
DCWL Analyst Safety Concern:
There were no safety concerns observed during the home inspections. The DCWL
analyst was present during the entrance meeting to discuss her home visits.
Chief Administrator Assessment:
During the inspection entrance meeting, the Chief Administrator discussed his
findings, which were consistent with the findings of the inspection.
Interviews
The staff and supervisors interviewed reported no concerns with the program. They
indicate that, despite the challenges brought about by working from home and
service restrictions, they have maintained good communication with their peers,
supervisors, and the administration. They reported that this has helped them
maintain family services as well as rule/policy compliance during this period under
review.
7

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes or policy. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the facility continue on a regular license.
September 22, 2020
________________________________________
Holly Austin Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
September 23, 2020
________________________________________
Claudia Triestram Date
Area Manager
